intro: Tinguarra montana, commonly known as the mountain tinguarra, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Tinguarra montana thrives in well-drained soils and requires a sunny to partially shaded environment. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and conservation efforts in its native habitat.
